website_summaries.verdict: One expects more from products marketed as "commercial grade." You can do better.
pros: Commercial grade, with plenty of power
Pumps easy and cleans-up easy after use
cons: Prone to leaking and also loses pressure easily
Confusing instructions - unit is difficult to assemble

customer_reviews.title: Very Dissatisfied!!!
customer_reviews.text: After only 3 uses of this product, the plunger o-ring deteriorated, making it inoperable. The distributor of this product had no clue, after a 45 min conversation so I emailed the distributor and they told me to call the manufacturer. I have had no reply from the manufacturer. This was a wasted $45.00 purchase. Very frustrated and di ssatisfied!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Texaslittle

customer_reviews.title: Weak plastic breaks where the pump screws in..
customer_reviews.text: This sprayer was promising at first. I decided to purchase this sprayer in order to spray Boracare in my basement and it worked excellently at first. This sprayer is very easy to operate as well. However (and this is a BIG however), the plastic that makes the pump able to screw in and locks it in place broke. Therefore, the sprayer is now unusable. I've extremely dissatisfied with this product and do not recommend it due to the cheap plastic that will not stand up to repeated twisting when the pump is screwed into place. Mine broke after only 3-4 uses.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Product failed in less than 3 months. A factory ...
customer_reviews.text: Product failed in less than 3 months. A factory seem just below the pressure relief valve burst . I intend on contacting the manufacturer to see if they will warranty this item. 05/17/2017 Manufacturer contacted me promptly regarding my issues and offered a free replacement.Also talked with their technical department. They wanted to see if it could possibly be a widespread issue that needed to be looked in to. Upgrading my review to 4 stars. There is something to be said for good customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never did work well for me.
customer_reviews.text: I've suffered through 3 years with this inferior sprayer. From the get-go it has been a real time waster and a pain. Sometimes I'd have pressure and sometimes not. I only spray once a year so my patience wasn't really tried until this year. Well, some brainiac engineer devised a connection that requires the customer to line up 2 clearly transparent plastic "wings" with another clearly transparent plastic "seat". A fine example of engineering for engineers instead of engineering for customers. It has been grossly inefficient in getting the job done in a timely fashion. I recommend against this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mahubs

customer_reviews.title: I used super glue to glue it back and was able to ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this sprayer for my garden use for about 4-5 times a year. The core of the pump cracked in the second year. I used super glue to glue it back and was able to continue to use and maintain pressure. Then just for another yerar, the tank itself start to leak. I have no idea how such a heavy tank would leak. My original decision to buy this brand was based on the lable "made in the USA". What a big disappointment and shame! Could have purchased a much cheaper one and last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Taiyang

customer_reviews.title: It still does not seal. No pressure.
customer_reviews.text: It appears like the Viton seals do not last. I have had this sprayer for a while and I am still having problems with the pressure. I was advised to apply Vaseline to the seals but that didn't work. I picked up a $10 sprayer and do not have any problems with the seal. I really like the features, but if I can't find a proper seal to make the sprayer hold pressure I will be throwing it in the trash or if possible burning it. Totally disgusted! The worst part is it is made in the USA, that's why I purchased it in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: William Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tree spraying.
customer_reviews.text: As they say "The right tool for the right job!" This is the right tool for spraying trees and bushes. Using for personal residence use on our 25 ft olive trees and other fruiting trees to control the fruit. Extra wand length, spray attachments, and spray control nozzle help get to higher places and hard to reach places. Comes with several spray attachments (nozzles) that are a little confusing how each one works, so you just have to try each one - they all have different spray radius and distance. Easy to use. Had been using lower cost canisters with less features, but this one makes the extra cost worth it. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: LetsBeHonest

customer_reviews.title: Best sprayer for the money, contract grade
customer_reviews.text: I have a medium to large yard and needed a sprayer that would last longer than one season. I watched a YouTube video and this was the #1 recommendation for my size yard. It hasn’t disappointed. Pros Good control of product Good size Not too heavy when full Keeps pressure Comes with several heads Parts are easy to find if they need replacement Cons Might not be enough if you have a large yard Overall it is a best in class product and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: luke fichtner

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in quality for price paid.
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of purchasing cheap sprayers at big box stores that would only work for a year or two so I spent a few bucks more on the Smith Contractor sprayer thinking I would have a better quality sprayer for a longer period of time. Worked well a couple times and then I couldn't pump much pressure into it. The hose and nozzles were nice but I can no longer make use of them if I can't pump pressure into the spray bottle. The lesson I learned is that you probably need to spend big bucks for a good metal sprayer or just stick with periodically replacing the cheaper plastic sprayers purchased at box stores.
customer_reviews.author: hydroguy

customer_reviews.title: it is an excellent product. The 5 heads give it very good ...
customer_reviews.text: This came today & I tried it out immediately. As far as a sprayer goes, it is an excellent product. The 5 heads give it very good flexibility. The brass head goes from a very fine mist to a strong but not incredibly coarse stream. It will shoot the stream straight up about 15 feet, 20 or more on an arc. The build quality and materials are excellent for the price. It is really a solid unit. It is not often I get something where I can say it exceeded my expectations. This sprayer does just that.
customer_reviews.author: J. D.

customer_reviews.title: Like many other reviewers
customer_reviews.text: Like many other reviewers, I am unable to use this sprayer because it will not pressurize properly. The O-ring around the pump piston is too small to meet the inside of the barrel, so it does not make a proper seal. I was able to use it only once, and now it does not pressurize even when pumped hundreds of times. The one time it worked, it worked well, but it is now useless unless I can find a replacement O-ring that actually fits— something I thought would be easy to find, but so far I have had no luck (it does not seem to be listed on the company's website). I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: sandhobot

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this sprayer around the perimeter of a large rental house and property for bug control. After reading about the ailments of cheaper sprayers, I felt it was worthwhile to spend a bit more for something better. I'm glad I did. It's working as advertised and doesn't have that "cheap" feel, and everything is stronger. The chemicals used for killing bugs aren't something I want dripping around from poor fittings or unexpected spills.
customer_reviews.author: walkrdg

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for semi commercial use, unbeatable price.
customer_reviews.text: As a contractor for 18 years I have to say this is pretty good for the value especially if you are a homeowner it's a must get. I've only used it for a couple weeks now, and it works great very strong pressure. I'm sure it will be even better with the new upgraded rubber washers that people are claiming in the reviews. Would have given this a five-star but the hose kind of leaks a little bit it just drips my first day of using it. Have used many sprayers all in all pretty good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Give this a try, bad reviews should be ignored.
customer_reviews.text: I have used a lot of these type of sprayers in the past, This one has been great. Always holds pressure, sprays good and it's made, Very durable for the price. Most of the Bad reviews I read on this sprayer sound like they are most likely operator error, Because the wand has a Built-in safety latch to allow pressure to release from sprayer when not in use, And as far as the safety valve on the side it specifically shows how to install it if not done correctly the valve will leak. I will definitely purchase more of Smith products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Charece

customer_reviews.title: Pump Broke after 1 season and no way to get a hold of anyone for support!
customer_reviews.text: Worked good for a few months but then the pimp attachment to the sprayer broke on me. It was plastic and from the normal motion of opening and closing caused it to break. I can not find anyway to contact the customer for warranty issues and have no recourse as of now other than to find a different distributor.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Betschart

customer_reviews.title: O-ring seal issue
customer_reviews.text: Ok this is a good sprayer EXCEPT the o-ring that seals the piston shrinks/wears within a year and the thing is useless--won't build pressure during pumping. After this happened to my two sprayers, I replaced the o-ring with a slightly larger one. They use a #324 o-ring (1.77" OD x 1.35" ID). I substituted a metric, slightly oversized o-ring (46mm OD x 34mm ID) and it seems to work much better. A little harder to pump but a solid seal and I'm guessing will not loose its seal quite as fast. Be sure to lubricate o-ring & bore. Nitrile (buna-n) O-rings are resistant to most oils...and available on amazon...
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: I'm going on my second pump assembly for this sprayer ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm going on my second pump assembly for this sprayer. This is used maybe a couple of times a month and I always remove the pressure when storing. Don't buy this sorry sprayer! I could have bought two of the cheaper models that would have lasted longer than this "high end" model!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Smith

customer_reviews.title: Only sprayer to buy
customer_reviews.text: I've tried other sprayer brands, some well-respected and others that are mid-tier national brands. Of them all, the Smith Contractor sprayer is the only one I will buy again. Nice features: -You get several nozzle types for all sorts of applications, including a high-pressure nozzle -Everything is very sturdy feeling, down to the strap -Oh, it has a strap! Super handy while hauling it around the garden -Consistent pressure throughout the use. You don't have to stop and prime it to get the sprayer to perform as often as you do with other brands. Bad features: -I really can't think of anything.
customer_reviews.author: ph301

customer_reviews.title: First Class
customer_reviews.text: Right off bat you realize this is a tool with quality. Unit requires assembly of wand but any anyone should be able to conquer screwing the parts together. I applied liquid soap to threads to help prevent galling of threads. Once things were all connected rinsed tank to remove any potential nozzle clogging. Put water in tank and pumped it up for functional testing. Sprayer works like a charm, much superior to the typical stuff found at big box stores. Expect this will be with me for years.
customer_reviews.author: jet2

customer_reviews.title: Came in filthy and used.
customer_reviews.text: The product came in its original box as shown in pictures. However when I opened the box every part was dirty, dusty and the gallon had some dirty liquid in it. We are sure we received a used Product. Nevertheless we have used it as weed sprayer. The assembly was not as difficult. The gallon mouth is wide enough to easily pour solution. My problem is with the pump. Have to pump several times for smooth spray. The gallon has a stand to stand it upright but it makes the product much bulkier. They should have provided a backpack type of straps instead of shoulder strap. Overall not a bad product but TOO EXPENSIVE.
customer_reviews.author: SV

customer_reviews.title: Just as shown
customer_reviews.text: This sprayer works far better than any I have ever had. Once pumped I can do my entire front yard (about 3/4 of an acre) without needing to repumping. Fairly easy to assemble though I wish the instructions included more pictures rather than names of parts that I did not recognize. Since I don't need to repump often I wish I could carry it on my back.
customer_reviews.author: asooner

customer_reviews.title: Great Value  Neck seal could be better.
customer_reviews.text: I have Two - 2 Gal versions of this sprayer that I have used for years and perform very well - better than their prime competitor (C*****) which I also own. The multiple nozzles are a plus. This one, unlike my others, is a little hard to get a good neck seal - your really have to crank down on it. Still I would buy again for my needs. Is it as good as B&G? - no but it is 1/10 the price.
customer_reviews.author: TDB

customer_reviews.title: Much improved Garden Sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sprayer to replace an older one I have worn out and is no longer made. The instructions for assembly need to be followed carefully, and it works fine. I use mine just for spraying Roundup, so I don't drain & rinse it out. It is furnished with a shoulder carrying strap, but it is awkward for me: I just carry it by its pump handle, which locks easily in place. I just use one of the four spray nozzles; the small black plastic one, which works fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: Wizard of WID

customer_reviews.title: Hose kinks preventing free flow
customer_reviews.text: The hose that connects the tank and the wand is made of a thin plastic material. After a year of purchase, a permanent kink developed in the hose near its connection to the wand causing intermittent flow obstruction. I needed to use the other hand to constantly straighten the hose making it very awkward to use. It's a shame that the sprayer is otherwise well made except that they cheapened on the hose material which is a critical part of the sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: T. W.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable & Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Smith's contractor series sprayers are tops in my book. I've used them for years and have not had a single failure. Even their Professional series is great. I've put a couple of them to some really hard use and never had a problem. The contractor series is the same but with a pressure relief valve and a wand holder. The pressure relief is a real blessing when it's time to remove the pump for a refill. I definitely recommend this sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Kline

customer_reviews.title: Potential
customer_reviews.text: Oh the potential for this was so high. A metal nozzle and easy carry handle were a great idea. Unfortunately the wand was too long for my purpose and wasn't nearly as maneuverable as I wanted. The hoses are heavy duty and again unfortunately not flexible enough for what I needed. I use it to mist my animal cages and although it could have worked great it was just too big and clumsy to work. It might be good for yardwork. I can't say.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Very good, but could be better
customer_reviews.text: The is my second, and the only reason I bought another was for another purpose. With two modifications the rating would be 5 stars. The problem is that over time the hose collapses at the tank exit or at the other end which impedes the flow. The simple addition of support at both ends might solve the problem, similar an encompassing spring such as on a some garden hoses.
customer_reviews.author: Tejas

customer_reviews.title: Second unit in four years failed
customer_reviews.text: I only use this sprayer once a year. To nail weeds already growing in the river rock and areas where I need it completely dead. I clean out and rise the containers. Fill with water several times, prime the pump and spray out any remnants every end of summer. But come spring, this is the second unit where the seals have totally failed. I guess they dry out over winter. Bad rubber material. I will not buy the Smith version again. Reviews were high at the time, but now I see recent reviews have dropped the average to below four stars.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Test Pilot

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best piece of equipment I own! I’ve used it hundreds of times to spray herbicides and it worked just as well for spraying stain on a fence. The only maintenance I did was to religiously clean out the tank and spray nozzle with water after every use. I just wish that other equipment that I’ve paid much more for would work and last half as long!
customer_reviews.author: Delmargirl

customer_reviews.title: Shut off failing after 3 seasons of light use, BUT covered by warranty
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in 2015, and was impressed with it until this year... While spraying parts of my lawn with a moss-killer, the shut off started to fail; would not completely stop the spray. And it got worse in the course of 2 hours. Called number on Website to get replacement parts, and they told me it's covered under warranty, took my info and they are sending me the parts. Assuming it all works out, that's pretty good customer service!
customer_reviews.author: R. Hale

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Especially for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Was a professional landscaper, so wanted something like used as a professional. This is close: sturdy, light weight, easy to carry with included strap, pressure relief valve is very important. Do wish the nozzles were not as tedious to change, but that is a minor thing. The main brass nozzle is used most of the time. Got what I expected and happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Bridges

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and durable; easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I've had this sprayer for several summers now, and it has held up really well. I've sprayed home-made weed killer (dish soap, vinegar, epsom salts) and also house-wash with it. It is easy to pressurize with the main pump and then super easy to spray. Just remember to empty it and spray it out after each use (okay to leave solution in it for a weekend, but I wouldn't recommend longer) and to leave it clean and loosely closed at the end of the gardening season so that it doesn't rust up on you.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Mooers

customer_reviews.title: This was a pretty good sprayer for the first season that we owned ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a pretty good sprayer for the first season that we owned and used it. The choice of materials however is deeply flawed. After about nine months the pump would no longer build pressure. It was easy enough to open and even add silicon grease to the piston o-ring. The problem is that the nylon cylinder swells in the presence of water. The increased diameter creates too much clearance between the bore and the o-ring. No amount of grease can resolve this design problem.
customer_reviews.author: Bullwinkle56

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: This sprayer does seem sturdier and better made than the ones you get at the "big box "stores. I used it today and it did retain the pressure to get a good spray with minimal pumping, but the red fan nozzle was no better than the cheaper ones. I then tried the bronze adjustable nozzle, which did better, but not the fan I need for the application I I want to do. I will keep it because I do think it is better made but I hope it doesn't take me forever when I am ready to spray the entire yard with my Tenacity mixture.
customer_reviews.author: Denice

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I could not be happier with this weed sprayer. I am female & started to order the 2 gallon container so I wouldn't have to refill so often, but ultimately opted for the 1 gallon sprayer & am glad I decided on that -- the 2 gallon container when filled with product would really have been too heavy & cumbersome to carry around the yard. For a guy, that would be okay. Anyway, it's a great quality, has multiple nozzles, the pressure release valve - &, well, everything I want in a sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: WhimZy

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: I had bought a cheap one originally and you get what you pay for. After a few uses pieces were breaking, wouldn’t hold pressure, etc. I’m glad I decided to chuck it and buy a good one. I’m SO glad I bought this sprayer. It’s great, the strap is comfortable, and the container holds pressure. Sprays really well and the hold button is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Massinok

customer_reviews.title: unable to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for wood staining.didn't work even with special nozzle. To be fair,the stain was a medium transparent type which is thicker than simple transparent stain. Worked fine as a water sprayer. Company was very helpful in sending special nozzle at no charge.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Z

customer_reviews.title: Works better than any other i have purchased
customer_reviews.text: I give this 4 stars and would have given it 5 but this one little thing just ticks me off. Would it kill the mfg of this sprayer to mark the one gallon and 2 gallon marks on the container in black or any color at all? You can see where the 2 gal mark is or the one gal mark. Little things mean a lot. Other than that the sprayer works better than any i have owned.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Simply setup. Great job dealing my driveway
customer_reviews.text: Used this to spray sealer on my concrete driveway. It worked great w/o issues. Loaded the sealer through the top opening big mouth, turned to lock, took about 10 good long stroke pumps to pressurize, then squeezed the handle to spray. I got a strong pressurized spray that dispensed a good amount of clear water based acrylic sealer. I do like the pressure release value and the adjustable nozzle. Also the setup out of the box was very simple, a few connections and you're ready to go. Rain beads up and don't soak into concrete. Clean up w water after the job. Ready for the next job, acid staining the patio!
customer_reviews.author: Dano

customer_reviews.title: I had no idea sprayers were supposed to work like this!
customer_reviews.text: After years of fooling around with the mfg included weed sprayer I decided to try this sprayer... whoa What a difference it’s made!!! I had no idea sprayers were supposed to work like this!!! Instead of a feeble drip it’s a full legit spray!! I was able to cover a large hillside in one hour! It would have taken days with the sprayer that comes with the weed killer!!! I live in a fire zone and it’s important to keep hillside areas clear of brush etc. As I am 67 yes old it’s hard enough with a drip spray wand... best money I’ve spent for yard stuff in ages. If you do a lot of spraying, GET THIS!!
customer_reviews.author: debbie koss

customer_reviews.title: Works great.! Just a few pump actions and it ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great.! Just a few pump actions and it goes forever. It seems not to clog even when using dome thick weed killer solutions. Did not give it 5 stars because extra replacement gaskets are not provided with original package. Even on line, these gaskets are not offered. So it seems when these gaskets get worn out, you need to replace whole sprayer, which is not cheap, over $50. I also bought previously a two gal unit, same excellent quality, but again no extra gaskets. Other much cheaper units all are sold with replacement gaskets. Go figure.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel A. Del Guercio

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: It does a nice job of spraying. You do not have to keep pumping it for it to maintain the continuous spray. However, there is no real measuring indicator on the side of the canister. I put my own on it, but it would be nice to have the markers on it by the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Debra M.

customer_reviews.title: Used to clean mini split evaporator
customer_reviews.text: Read my review on the SpeedClean MSB-KIT Mini Split Bib Kit and you'll see why I bought this sprayer. It has interchangeable nozzles that let you choose a spray pattern. I used a brass nozzle that was more of a stream, and it worked well to blast out a couple of years worth of dust, dirt, and mold accumulation in my mini split. I'm sure the small pressure washers they sell on here work better, but for something I'll use twice a year, I wasn't ready to dump that much money not knowing how long it will last. This got the job done, probably not as quickly but it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis C. Bernth

customer_reviews.title: Great working, solid built sprayer.
customer_reviews.text: Great sprayer. The two gallon size was perfect for use in my 1 acre lot. I use this for 2,4-d to spray and kill broad leaf weeds and it has worked perfectly for that application. The extra tips included was a nice bonus also. The strap is a bit flimsy so I just made a new one with branded paracord. Other than the strap issue I highly recommend this well built rock solid sprayer!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This product works exactly as intended. After about 5 months of use, the top gasket has started to break down, but all that means is that I have to screw down the top tighter than usual to create a seal (and I expect replacement to be cheap and easy; and this is normal wear-and-tear IMO for these kinds of parts). After 3 months of use the connection between the hose and the container began to leak whenever the container is under pressure -- it's an annoying, small leak but not too much of a problem if you don't leave the container alone for too long (otherwise you'll return to a puddle).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No longer builds pressure
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2016 and have used it about 5 times since. I cleaned it and stored as specified in the manual, but mow it no longer will hold any air pressure. The O ring and check valve all look like they do the day I got, so those are not the issue.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Finally, one that works...
customer_reviews.text: At times, I ask myself....Self, how much will it cost to find the best XXXX. In this case, it is the price of this sprayer. I bought two different sizes and both work to my expectations. One awesome feature is the pressure relief button, which allows depressuring after use, without unscrewing the pump and spraying chemicals in your face. The pump is quite efficient, with minimal pumps to keep the pressure up. Quality product at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: The Wizard

customer_reviews.title: ... my fence with the wide nozzle and it worked great.
customer_reviews.text: Used it with Ready Seal stain for my fence with the wide nozzle and it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: steeler2010

customer_reviews.title: Sprayer
customer_reviews.text: It was a little difficult to hook up as you have to be sure to get the hose placed just right or it will be difficult to use while spraying, but once I got it around in the correct position it works great. The hose is lots stiffer than my old one and that was a problem until I moved the position some before tightening it up.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Needs a better feed hose
customer_reviews.text: Big Problem with feed hose kinking. After storing sprayer here in central Florida in a garage for several months the feed hose developed a kink where it meets the wand and where it meets the tank. I have to hold the hose at a certain angle while I'm spraying to keep it from flattening OUT AND CHOKING THE FLOW. This is in a word...maddening. The sprayer works Ok otherwise but this issue makes it a DNB-do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Sweedledick

customer_reviews.title: Great Sprayer; Perfect Size for Yard and Garden
customer_reviews.text: For most homeowners, this is a perfect size at 2 gallons. I use mine primarily for vinegar / salt / detergent solutions to keep weeds off of driveways and walkways. It takes just an hour two or three times a summer to keep them looking nice. No muss, no fuss.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: Very poor sprayer and no response from the seller.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit last summer and the seal on the pump has failed completely. It took 30 pumps when mine was full when I purchased it. I should have returned it but we have a large garden and needed a sprayer. I thought I could just get back to you soon a repair kit when it failed, but there is no repair kit for this sprayer, Loved the different nozzles. We just use regular herbicide and no soap. Very disappointed for the cost of this sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: freddier

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra money
customer_reviews.text: I really think it's stupid that we have so many products for the same simple thing. But again I did buy the cheaper sprayers to start and I realized that I needed something that actually worked like it should. Just spend the money, and start here. It's an investment for a tank sprayer, but it's worth it in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: luminairefoto

customer_reviews.title: It is American Made!
customer_reviews.text: I like the different spray nozzles that come with it. It develops good pressure and it is easy to carry with the included carrying strap. Comes with a one year warranty. My first impression is its a product that will last a little longer then the ones sold in the big local stores. At least it doesn't say "made in China"
customer_reviews.author: Melvin Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Buy USA
customer_reviews.text: Love that it is made in America. The pressure relief valve is a great feature. You don’t have to over tighten the pumper. Comes with an assortment of spay tips to meet anyone’s need. Appears to be constructed well. I bought the 1 gallon over the 2 gallon model and it has met my needs perfectly. The design seems to be less cumbersome than the typical oblong sprayers
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: The Last Garden Sprayer I Will Have to Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This Garden Sprayer is light weight and durable. It Sprays well and adjusts to any situation. We have used it many times this Summer and it is so much better than our old heavy metal sprayer that constantly clogged. If by chance something does go wrong with it we would purchase another one just like it in a Heart Beat.
customer_reviews.author: bonrae

customer_reviews.title: Best iv owned
customer_reviews.text: Love this sprayer. I use it on my acre yard to kill grass/weeds around trees and septic tanks. Easy to fill, easy to see level. Easy to pump and holds. The extra style tips are really handy. Well thought out spray bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Toyotatech21

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and mix solutions. Easy to clean when you're done. Replacement parts (specifically the o-rings are inexpensive through the manufacturer). The only negative is the shoulder strap does NOT stay attached like it should. It came off 3x during my first use. But overall a great product.
customer_reviews.author: nibbyquilter

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and durable
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived on time, I was so impressed with the first one I purchased, I bought another one....yes it was a little more $$ then I planned on spending, but this is heavy duty, and I can’t say enough, as to how much better this is compared to the Hudson ones that we always bought. I like the different hose tips it comes with also. I expect this to outlast our old Hudson ones.
customer_reviews.author: Olive

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: We do a lot of spraying for weeds. The last sprayer broke and the description of this product sounded great and it was. The brass tip is special when it come to spraying. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bernhardt

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to pressurize and it held its pressure
customer_reviews.text: I used this with a deck cleaner, a stain stripper and an Armstrong-Clark deck oil with a red stain. The sprayer functioned very well, with no clogging at all. It was easy to pressurize and it held its pressure, even over several days. Best sprayer I've used it. I hope I can use it for some garden uses, but if not, I'll still feel I got my money's worth.
customer_reviews.author: greatlegs

customer_reviews.title: It works but not impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I tried it with water and it wouldn't hold pressure so I added baking soda and it worked like a charm. The real challenge will be when I put the weed killer in it. It could spray a little further but I think it will work just fine.. I used it yesterday with a weed killer and wasn't too impressed with the spray pattern. I used the black and the red nozzles. Some people say they use it to stain or wash a car. In my case the spray is so weak that wouldn't work. I guess for the price it's ok. I would have chosen a little more expensive model.
customer_reviews.author: RKA

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the cheap sprayer that turned me into swamp thing
customer_reviews.text: Much better than the one I had previously which sprayed fluid all over whenever opening. This one has a pressure release valve to eliminate that problem. Seems well made, although I would prefer a metal wand like the premium sprayer. I would also like a place to keep the extra nozzles. But overall it is great and a definitely improvement over the one I bought before which didn't even spray properly from the start, don't try to save $10 and just go ahead and get a contractor grade sprayer. Much better than spraying glycophosphate in your eyes and turning into swamp thing like I did.
customer_reviews.author: J. Burg

customer_reviews.title: It's a work out...
customer_reviews.text: I was going back and forth between an electric and manual sprayer for my large backyard. I even asked a community question and everyone thought manual would work, as manual is a great deal cheaper. It wasn't worth it. Between the constantly feeling it up, the pumping to make it spray and then carrying around the weight - it was too much for me. I'm a 40s, female and I enjoy outdoor work but I only used this once. The pumping isn't easy and it's really heavy to lag around.
customer_reviews.author: TerinaC

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: Best sprayer I've ever found. I have two now, and not because the first one quit. I've had the other one for about 2 years, and it still has pressure weeks later even if I forget to bleed it down. It's slightly higher than other sprayers maybe, but darn well worth it, and this is from someone who has owned a myriad of other cheaper sprayers over the years that didn't last long or quit pressurizing. You won't regret buying one.
customer_reviews.author: Dirks44

customer_reviews.title: Not too heavy
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something more substantial than my current sprayer and the Smith Sprayer has worked out perfectly for a 150'x50' section of hillside. I only had to refill once. If, I didn't have arthritic hands I would have gotten the larger size.
customer_reviews.author: D. Owen

customer_reviews.title: Good sprayer with nice features.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so I could have one for poisons and one for fertilizers. Have used it to spray all of the azaleas and hedges in my yard (quite a few of them). and it does not take much pumping to get it up to pressure. I like the interchangeable tips. So far, I have had no problems with it at all. I like the bottom section which stabilizes it when sitting on the ground. It does not tip over as easily as my old one.
customer_reviews.author: JDB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, sturdy build and user friendly. Holds pressure for a long time. Comes with a variety of spray nozzles. Used it for algae removal (Wet and Forget) for which it's the perfect choice.
customer_reviews.author: fretho

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sprayer as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I had view this product on YouTube and it is every thing they said it can do. This sprayer require fewer pumping to achieve the pressure compared to the other brands. This product includes various types of spray pattern fittings too. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Golden State Warriors Fan

customer_reviews.title: I bought this sprayer in July 2016 and when I ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sprayer in July 2016 and when I got ready to use it today (to spray for ants) the pump does not work. I found a replacement pump for $9.95 and shipping (for me) is another $9.11. The Craftsman I replaced this with lasted almost 30 years before the pump went out. Considering I have gotten less than 2 years (7/2016 - 5/2018) use (spray once a month for ants) it is really not worth the money in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Hewes TF17

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: This is heavy duty and I think it should last much longer than the big box store varieties. At first, I thought I would prefer a metal tank but I like being able to see the liquid level through the plastic reservoir. Having the metal fittings and thick hose make this unit very desirable.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Its ok but nozzles are pretty cheap
customer_reviews.text: Its sturdy and heavy duty but the spray nozzles are pretty cheap in my opinion. I was hoping for something more professional grade. Its also heavy if you put 3 gallons in it so be prepared. I use it to blanket spray lawn treatments.
customer_reviews.author: J. England

customer_reviews.title: This is the best sprayer I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: This is the best sprayer I've ever used.....for the first two months. And then the ring stops to seal. I've bought 4 of these, and it happened on three of them. I've also had an issue on one where the hose kinked permanently. Still, solid sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Leaking Air
customer_reviews.text: I've only used the sprayer a few times, but it won't hold a seal and you can hear the air escaping. I've tried lubricating the gasket, but that still doesn't help. With the air escaping, one must pump it continuously. I'm very unhappy with this purchase. I thought I was upgrading from my first sprayer, but that wasn't the case.
customer_reviews.author: T. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for portable shower
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to make a portable shower for camping trips. No need to reconfigure or fabricate anything to make it work since it comes ready to accept a screw-on garden nozzle. Can also lock it open and then use the garden nozzle for off/on. Would happily buy another when we're in the market for a chemical sprayer in the future since it seems better made than cheap ones at hardware stores.
customer_reviews.author: Delahah

customer_reviews.title: Top piece that screws to the container wearing our...
customer_reviews.text: Orginally I really liked this. It is heavy duty everything. I am now having trouble with the top, plastic. When I try to tighten it seems ok, when I try to take off to fill the plastic slips and it is wearing out. I do not use every day. Weekly at best. I need a new top piece. I have a brand new one, out of the box but ordered Order detailsOrdered on September 11, 2016 (1 item) Smith Contractor 190216 2-Gallon Sprayer for Weed Killers, Herbicides, and Insecticides D.B. Smith Sold by: Amazon.com LLC IT WILL NOT HOLD PRESSURE. WHAT CAN BE DONE?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smith sprayers are worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.text: There are cheaper sprayers available but Smith sprayers are worth the extra money. They are built well and work consistently. They don't leak. They come with an assortment of nozzles. They last for years when properly maintained.
customer_reviews.author: ScottB

customer_reviews.title: well made product
customer_reviews.text: pump works well and fast. The drip tray at the bottom is cool, I have this in customers houses every day.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Carter

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I've used many sprayers over the years, but none as well made as this one. We'll see how it holds up over time, but I suspect it will last far longer than those from the big box stores. I thought the price was quite reasonable as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Well made sprayer.
customer_reviews.text: I loved it. I been using this for a while now and I like it because the size is good enough for me. Everything seems well made. So far the pump and the spray is working great. I do not know how long this will last, only time will tell. So far, I am very happy with it. A total upgrade from what I got from home depot years ago.
customer_reviews.author: genie

customer_reviews.title: Need available repair parts for this model.
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth one, so obviously I like them. What I do not like is the lack of repair parts for this particular model. (They do have repair parts for other models on their website.). Of course, it is an issue of money, but more importantly I hate to throw away a chunk of plastic when I don’t have to.
customer_reviews.author: Grammy O

customer_reviews.title: The construction looks durable and well made, however after ...
customer_reviews.text: The construction looks durable and well made, however after the first use, I never was able to get the pressure built up to spray, even after following the instructions and taking apart and cleaning. The cheap ones I bought at Home Depot as a replacement work just as well after multiple uses.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Way Ahead
customer_reviews.text: I have had a number of sprayers over the years. Mostly recognizable brand names. Almost all had a habit of quitting within a year or so of purchase. I finally decided to read some ratings and perhaps spend a bit more money. The DB Smith sprayer, Professional Contractor Series is a true value. I liked the first one so much I bought a second one so I could spray differing solutions. Both units are still performing, and I only spent a couple of bucks more. But as they are still doing the job, I am way ahead.
customer_reviews.author: boulanger

customer_reviews.title: Good Sprayer, Lasts 2 Years
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered my fourth one because they break every two years. It's a good product, but you should think of it as more of a subscription than a one-time purchase. Maybe Amazon should make this a "Subscribe & Save" item, and deliver a new one every two years.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Nelson

customer_reviews.title: This one will last.
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of the cheap sprayers failing after limited use. This sprayer feels and looks of high quality. I can't give a long term review yet, but I think that this one will be the last sprayer that'll I'll need.
customer_reviews.author: krome2ez

customer_reviews.title: Garden Sprayer
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace old garden sprayer as nozzle stopped working. This is heavy duty and seems to have better parts so should hold up longer. I also learned it's important to spray water through the hose and nozzle when done so it doesn't end up clogging.
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: ... and find the one gallon model to be the perfect size to carry around with me
customer_reviews.text: I've used this a couple times so far this season and find the one gallon model to be the perfect size to carry around with me ... (even that gets heavy after a while!) and the spray head is very reliable. I also like the pump handle (which doubles as a screw top). The last unit I had (different brand) was extremely hard to disengage the screw mechanism in order to use the start the pump process.
customer_reviews.author: Pave

customer_reviews.title: Only got about 4 uses before it started leaking
customer_reviews.text: O ring in trigger assembly deteriorated after several uses and now it's leaking. The opening to fill and remove contents from the sprayer could have a better design to prevent spillage when transferring fluids.
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: I have used for one summer and over all it ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used for one summer and over all it has worked well. However, about halfway through the summer I did start experiencing issues with the spray wand leaking when not pulling the trigger. A steady drip. It did not do this when I first got it. When stored I release all pressure and empty contents into a different storage container and triple rinse the tank and sprayer assembly. I would expect leaking from a cheaper tank sprayer but this shouldn't be happening with this one.
customer_reviews.author: C. K

customer_reviews.title: Good  Sprayer
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd year using this sprayer. I always rinse tank and clear hose with water after using, One minor complaint is the hose sometimes kinks where it attaches to the tank depending on how its held, which diminishes spraying pressure. I've never had a cheap sprayer last 3 yrs so i'm satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: joell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use & well made
customer_reviews.text: I just discarded 2 older sprayers that never worked very well from the beginning. Took a chance on this one & it works flawlessly. Easy to set up & easy to use. Appears to be well made as well. I would definitely recommend this sprayer to anyone in need of a quality unit.
customer_reviews.author: Joker In The Mist

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work OK.
customer_reviews.text: Came with a brass adjustable tip and two plastic fan nozzles. Seems to work OK. The clip to attach the wand and the attached drip cup for it are a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: NCHTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: This was a good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Best sprayer I have ever purchased. Well made, and got the job done, don’t expect any problems in future. I expect it will last a long time as long as I flush it out well after each use. It’s easy to use and care for, and I’m happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: kd

customer_reviews.title: I would buy this product again.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this sprayer all summer and it has performed well. It’s sturdy and puts out a generous spray or stream. I use weed killer in it. I will be buying another one for a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Rett Zimm

customer_reviews.title: Seals leak lawn dye - very messy to use
customer_reviews.text: Took a chance on this because of positive reviews, but the release valve and the tank itself appears to leak a lot when I add Lazer Blue Dye. Would appreciate it if manufactuo would contact me and send replacement seals to correct issue. Will update as appropriate.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Vose

customer_reviews.title: Quality parts except for the pump.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the spray nozzle and parts is very good. There are several types of nozzles that will do most any job. The hose, wand, and tank are very adequate and hold up well. The pump is marginal. It requires 2-3 times as many strokes to get a good spray compared to 2 other brands of sprayer that I have. If you want exercise, this is your sprayer. If you want to get the job done, pick another
customer_reviews.author: RonS

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I am in my second year of using this sprayer and haven't had to replace a single seal. Not my usual experience with sprayers.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond A. Homewood

customer_reviews.title: Starts off as a good sprayer, but...
customer_reviews.text: While it took a *whole* lot more pumping than it should have, it did work decently during the first year. Come the second year, though, it no longer pumps more than a slight hiss when you release "pressure". It's a shame because the attachments were more than generous and the assembly was solid. The O-rings in the pumping portion must be shot because the assembly O-rings still retain integrity. It was stored in dry conditions and never with any liquid in the tank. Short term? This is a good sprayer. More than a year? You'll be looking into getting a new sprayer. I should have read the warnings.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P.

customer_reviews.title: Nice sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I loved this little sprayer. Just the right size. Excellent instructions. Easy to use. Unfortunately the tank was damaged in shipping (dropped directly on the hose attachment nipple). Seems sturdy enough for the price. Would buy one again
customer_reviews.author: Linny Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Broken in less than two years!
customer_reviews.text: It didn't even last me two years, before the pump quit. I don't think I've even used it enough to pump 12 gallons worth of liquid. I think it may be the rubber o-ring in the pump that no longer seals well, but I don't have the time to troubleshoot it right now. I'll buy something else that works. This is definitely not worth the money that they charge you for it.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Que

product_meta.title: Smith Contractor 190216 2-Gallon Sprayer for Weed Killers, Herbicides, and Insecticides
product_meta.description: Size:2 GallonSmith Contractor 190216 Sprayer is a commercial grade, multi-purpose, 2-gallon sprayer for cleaning, sanitizing, applying harsh chemicals as well as lawns and gardens. Sprayer features a lockable shut-off to reduce hand fatigue; a nickel-plated brass poppet for strength and precision; and an easy-to-clean, in-line filtration system. Viton seals offer the best chemical resistance to chemicals and are easily changed without using tools. The pressure release valve safely releases pressure from tank prior to opening to prevent accidental chemical spray. Multiple nozzles included for ultimate versatility: adjustable poly and brass nozzles (enables stream to cone patterns), 2 flat fans, and a high performance foaming nozzle. Also accepts Tee Jet nozzles.
feature_bullets: Versatile sprayer designed not only for lawns, but also for commercial cleaning, sanitizing, and applying harsh chemicals
Premium, commercial grade shut-off with comfortable grip; lock-on feature; and easy-to-clean, in-line filter
21-inch poly wand with Viton seals throughout pump and shut-off for long-term resistance to chemicals
Pressure release valve helps prevent chemicals from getting on you before opening the tank
Includes 5 nozzles for ultimate versatility: poly adjustable, brass adjustable, 2 flat fans, and a high performance foaming nozzle

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,772 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
